title: OKC conquers nerves to roll Nuggets, reach WCF
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder rolled into the Western Conference finals after beating the Nuggets 125-93 in Game 7 on Sunday.

title: Scheffler: Used new driver at PGA after failed test
content: Rory McIlroy's driver wasn't the only one the USGA deemed nonconforming in testing ahead of this week's PGA Championship. Scottie Scheffler confirmed Sunday after his five-stroke victory that he also was forced to use a new driver for the tournament.

title: Nuggets effusive in praise for interim Adelman
content: Nuggets interim coach David Adelman earned praise across the board for his performance during these playoffs and is considered a strong candidate to take over on a permanent basis.

title: Rahm after PGA collapse: 'Tough pill to swallow'
content: After being tied for the PGA Championship lead with nine holes to play, Jon Rahm came up seven shots short of winner Scottie Scheffler on Sunday.

title: Messi urges Miami to be 'united' in 'difficult' time
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi urged the team to stay strong and remain united after losing 3-0 to in-state rival Orlando City SC at Chase Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Liberty eliminates No. 1 Aggies to win regional
content: Liberty beat No. 1 Texas A&M 6-5 on Sunday night to win the Bryan-College Station Regional and eliminate the top-seeded Aggies.

title: WNBA probes 'hateful' comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA is looking into allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed at Angel Reese after an incident involving Caitlin Clark and Reese in Saturday's Sky-Fever game.

title: Marchand continues Game 7 mastery over Leafs
content: In his first season with Florida, forward Brad Marchand became the first player in NHL history to defeat the same opponent in at least five winner-take-all games, as his Panthers crushed the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-1 in Game 7 of the second round on Sunday.

title: Scheffler's PGA Championship win leaves the rest of the golf world playing catch-up
content: Jon Rahm made it close for a while, but Scottie Scheffler's inevitability hung in the Charlotte air all day.

title: New 2025 NBA mock draft: Cooper Flagg at No. 1, but who else makes the cut after the combine?
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: Best fits for remaining NFL free agents, trade candidates: Bowen picks new teams for 14 players
content: Where should J.K. Dobbins, Aaron Rodgers and Justin Simmons sign? Who should trade for Jalen Ramsey? Let's find fits for 14 available players.

title: Navy SEALs, John Legend and lobster mac & cheese: Inside an NFL rookie's first month
content: Rookies including Tyler Warren, Josh Conerly Jr. and Nick Martin share insight on their first days as an NFL player.

title: NBA playoff MVPs: Herring's new top 8 after the conference semis
content: Our playoff MVP update features a Game 7 savior, two Wolves and a superstar that hasn't played in three weeks.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Who wins the Eastern Conference finals? Early look at keys to Hurricanes-Panthers
content: It's a rematch of the 2023 edition. Can Carolina win this time, or will Florida head back to the Cup Final?

title: 'Ueck was always first': How Christian Yelich is carrying on Bob Uecker's legacy with Brewers
content: Whether he's starring or slumping, Christian Yelich has taken the torch as the face of the franchise in Milwaukee.

title: Indy 500 rookie Shwartzman wins pole in shocker
content: Robert Shwartzman, who has dual nationality in Israel and Russia, became the first Indy 500 rookie to qualify on the pole since Teo Fabi in 1983.

title: Christopher Bell beats Joey Logano to win NASCAR All-Star Race
content: Christopher Bell passed Joey Logano with nine laps remaining and cruised to victory in an action-packed NASCAR All-Star Race at North Wilkesboro Speedway on Sunday night.

title: Angel City's King: Medical team 'saved my life'
content: Angel City defender Savy King was released from the hospital Saturday, just more than a week after she collapsed on the field during a match.

title: Arteta challenges board to back him with signings
content: Mikel Arteta has challenged the Arsenal hierarchy to "do what they have to do" in the summer transfer market to turn the club into Premier League champions.

title: Conte sees red as Napoli cling to first in Serie A
content: Napoli's hopes of securing the Serie A title on Sunday had to be put on ice after they were held to a 0-0 draw at Parma.

title: Galaxy still winless after Tráfico draw with LAFC
content: Marco Reus scored twice, including the game-tying free kick in the 87th minute as the LA Galaxy earned a 2-2 tie with rival LAFC on Sunday night in Carson, California.

title: Ajax boss emotional after historic title collapse
content: Ajax manager Francesco Farioli has said he has no regrets despite his side finishing as runners-up in the Eredivisie in one of the biggest title collapses in history.

title: Flick 'fine' as Barça lose 1st in LaLiga since Dec.
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick was happy to write off his team's first league defeat since December as the newly crowned LaLiga champions lost 3-2 at home to Villarreal on Sunday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Jr. nets 1st Portugal U15s goals
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, scored his first two goals for Portugal's U15 side in Sunday's 3-2 victory against Croatia.

title: European soccer review: Premier League's UCL race sets up final-day fireworks
content: With one matchday left, the Premier League's European race is wide open. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Red Bull have taken a step forward, which means Max Verstappen's win might be a sign of things to come.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Chawinga's brilliance keeps Current No. 1
content: If you make a single mistake against Temwa Chawinga and the Current, you're likely to get punished. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Brazil clubs eye Ronaldo for Club World Cup
content: Will Cristiano Ronaldo be suiting up at the Club World Cup in June? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Centre sanctions ₹363.23 crore to improve drinking water supply in Guntur
content: Of the total funds, ₹331.10 crore will be utilised for the development of a dedicated pipeline to Gorantla area, while ₹32.13 crore has been earmarked to supply water to layouts situated downstream of Amrut water point, says Union Minister Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar

title: Imports hurting Himachal's apple industry, will write to PM on banning imports from Turkey: CM Sukhu
content: Himachal CM Sukhvinder Sukhu said he will urge the Centre to ban apple imports from Turkey, citing harm to local growers’ earnings

title: Meant to curb corruption, ED now caught up in it, says M.A. Baby
content: His statement comes as the Vigilance department intensifies its probe into bribery case involving ED officials from the Kochi unit

title: Heavy rain batters several parts of Tiruchi district
content: The downpour leaves behind a trail of destruction with several trees and electrical poles crashed; power supply was disrupted in many areas and roads were waterlogged

title: 100 vehicles seized, parents fined in crackdown on underage driving
content: The operation led to the seizure of 100 vehicles, including SUVs, and the imposition of fines amounting to ₹1.05 lakhs on parents and guardians

title: Central government continuing to privatise VSP through various means, say Left leaders
content: Leaders demand the State government to mount pressure on the Centre to give up its plan to privatise VSP, saying that it could be made a profit-making enterprise

title: Orthodox, Jacobite Churches face internal unrest over controversial remarks and leadership decisions
content: Discontent in Orthodox Church after Metropolitan of Adoor-Kadampanad diocese publicly described the Church leadership as ‘captors of parishes.’ Reappointment of Geevarghese Mar Coorilos as the Metropolitan of the Niranam diocese sparks disquiet in the Jacobite Church

title: Govt. hospital in Tiruchi to get PET scan centre soon
content: About ₹140 crore has been sought under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram  and staff for the scan centre, including medical and radiation oncologists, would be deputed from other institutions

title: PM abused Congress, now taking its help for diplomatic delegations: Ramesh
content: Four Congress leaders — Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, Amar Singh and Salman Khurshid — who were not part of the list sent by the Congress have been included in the delegations

title: Govt. extends term of P.C. Ghose Commission of Inquiry into Kaleshwaram Barrages till July 31
content: It is likely to examine Harish Rao, KCR and others before wrapping up the inquiry and submit report to the government

title: Forest dwellers play a significant role in conservation, says Minister
content: Eshwar Khandre distributes cheques to families that are voluntarily shifting out of Bhimgad Wildlife Sanctuary

title: Manapparai dairy farmers’ society disburses ₹1.62 crore bonus to members
content: The cooperative has 86 milk collection centres in seven villages with over 2,000 members supplying 25,000 litres of milk every day; its members are paid ₹2 extra per litre of milk

title: ‘Exorcist’, schoolgirl’s father escape POCSO Act conviction in Madras High Court due to doubts over her age
content: Justices A.D. Jagadish Chandira and K. Rajasekar of Madras High Court, however, punish the two convicts under the Indian Penal Code

title: IMD forecasts heavy rainfall in several Bengal districts
content: Heavy rainfall likely to occur in north Bengal districts of Darjeeling, Kalimpong; thunderstorms likely to occur in south Bengal districts of Purulia

title: Maharashtra Government issues directives to strengthen healthcare system
content: Maharashtra Health Minister Prakash Abitkar directed officials to draft a Health Policy and issued steps to improve healthcare and ensure transparent transfers of medical officers

title: YSRCP former MP Nandigam Suresh sent to judicial remand in an attempt to murder case
content: The police arrested the former Member of Parliament again on the fresh case of attempt to murder, taking the total cases to 12 on him

title: How much rainwater can be collected in a day from a 100 sq.m. rooftop? Enough for a family of four for at least 3 days
content: Experts say, by harvesting rainwater people can colect enough for a family of four for at least 3 day

title: Opposition BJP demands ₹1,000-cr relief for Bengaluru; says single spell of rain has dented city’s image at global level
content: Leader of the Opposition R. Ashok said a single-day’s rainfall had exposed the true colours of the Congress government’s “Brand Bengaluru.”

title: Rahul targets Jaishankar, says his silence ‘damning’; it’s Pakistan’s language, says BJP
content: “EAM Jaishankar’s silence isn’t just telling, it’s damning. So I’ll ask again: How many Indian aircraft did we lose because Pakistan knew?” Rahul Gandhi said in a post on X

title: Loco pilots should switch off personal mobile phone when train is moving; use official phone only during emergencies: Railway Board
content: A monthly summary of the checks conducted, violations detected, and the action taken should be submitted from every division every month, it added

title: Rayapati Sailaja assumes charge as Chairperson of Andhra Pradesh State Women’s Commission
content: She also announced plans to launch a new website to enable women to directly report incidents and seek assistance from the Commission

title: All High Court judges entitled to full pension: Supreme Court
content: The Bench said discriminating among judges based on the timing of their appointment or their designation violates right to equality

title: In Mumbai, seized or abandoned vehicles can't be dumped in public places: Bombay High Court
content: Bombay High Court orders police stations in Mumbai to dispose of abandoned vehicles properly to free up space

title: CPI(M) Kerala secretary M.V. Govindan defends rapper Vedan, slams RSS
content: Govindan says Vedan’s music challenges caste oppression and resonates with the struggles of the marginalised

title: Foundation of Samajwadi Party based on casteism, appeasement: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak
content: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak accused the Samajwadi Party of a “Muslim appeasement” DNA following an objectionable post from the party’s X handle, as Akhilesh Yadav urged restraint from both sides

title: Human Rights Forum urges Andhra Pradesh Government to compensate deceased farmer
content: Human Rights Forum Rythu Swarajya Vedika and BC Welfare Association demand the implementation of financial assistance for the victim

title: Sambhal mosque row: Allahabad HC junks Masjid committee plea against survey
content: Allahabad High Court upholds Sambhal court’s order appointing Advocate Commissioner to survey Sambhal mosque in dispute

title: Ashoka University professor’s arrest is BJP’s attempt to ‘suffocate’ freedom of speech, alleges Congress
content: Supporting the armed forces and the government when national interest reigned supreme did not exclude holding the government accountable through questions, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said

title: P.K. Sreemathy slams police brutality against Dalit woman, backs suspension of SI but questions charges against CMO
content: Reacting to the Dalit woman’s revelation that she faced humiliation at Chief Minister’s Office when she attempted to file a complaint, Sreemathy expressed doubts about the claim

title: Mysore Rajamatha gifts two silver lamps to Tirumala temple
content: The act of donation, revives a centuries-old tradition of the Mysore kings, who were cherished for their deep reverence and generous patronage to the hill temple

title: Water hyacinth removal not permissible under MGNREGA, says Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Earlier, Kodikunnil Suresh, MP, had written to the Minister requesting that removal of water hyacinth from waterbodies in Kuttanad region in Kerala be included as a permissible activity under MGNREGA

title: T.N. Archaeology Department begins survey for excavation in Nagapattinam
content: Remains of Chudamani Vihara, a Buddhist monastery built during the reign of Rajaraja Chola I (985-1014 CE), are believed to be buried in the region

title: Kerala Police suspends Peroorkada SI for wrongful detention of Dalit woman that sparked political controversy
content: Sub-Inspector Prasad of Peroorkada police station in Thiruvananthapuram suspended in connection with wrongful detention of a Dalit woman, Bindu, on a now-disproven charge of pilfering a gold necklace from the house of her employer

title: ‘Damning indictment of government’: Congress on Supreme Court barring granting of retrospective environmental clearances
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that the judgment is a “damning indictment” of the Modi government whose domestic walk is “completely at variance” with its global talk as far as environmental protection is concerned

title: Interview | ‘Maranamass’ director Sivaprasad: The film is told from an experimental, quirky perspective
content: Debutant director Sivaprasad speaks of his love of stories to his penchant for creating quirky characters and situations

title: Bengaluru rains: Issues we face today are not new, working to solve them with long-term, sustainable solutions, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: The Bengaluru Development Minister said he was working round-the-clock to address challenges and ensure relief. He will be visiting the BBMP War Room and flood-affected areas personally to take stock on ground.

title: ‘Crass comments’: Supreme Court constitutes SIT to probe FIR against Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah
content: The court further questioned the lack of initiative shown by the State of Madhya Pradesh to register an FIR against the Minister or bring him to book

title: India’s global outreach on Operation Sindoor: Full list of delegation members and destinations
content: The seven delegations are scheduled to visit 32 countries, including the European Union headquarters in Belgium.

title: Don't bring local level politics into India's global outreach on terror: Pawar tells Raut
content: Mr. Pawar recalled that he was a member of a delegation sent by former Prime Minister P. V. Narasimha Rao to the UN under the leadership of BJP leader Atal Bihari Vajpayee

title: Five killed, two injured as car falls onto dry riverbed in Maharashtra’s Ratnagiri district
content: The accident occurred near Khed around 5:45 a.m., when the vehicle first hit the divider and fell into the dry river bed of the Jagbudi River

title: FIR against more than 100 people for unauthorised protests in Maharashtra’s Thane district
content: More than 100 people were booked in Thane district, Maharashtra, for participating in unauthorised human chain protests against a journalist’s externment order

title: India, Maldives sign 13 MoUs to implement projects under Indian grant assistance
content: The MoUs were signed by Abdulla Khaleel, Minister of Foreign Affairs, on behalf of the Maldivian government, and G Balasubramanian, the High Commissioner of India to the Maldives

title: ₹6,200 crore bank loan fraud case: ED arrests former UCO Bank CMD Subodh Kumar Goel on money-laundering charges
content: Subodh Kumar Goel was arrested at his residence in New Delhi in the case being probed against Concast Steel and Power Limited and others

title: Spying for Pakistan: ‘Verification under way; will investigate facts on Hisar woman’s links with Odisha YouTuber,’ says Puri SP
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a resident of Hisar, Haryana, was arrested for allegedly sharing sensitive information and being in continuous contact with a Pakistani citizen

title: Port curbs on imports from Bangladesh to have impact in Bengal, but national interest supreme: Officials
content: A trade expert said the finished garments from Bangladesh often make their way into modern Indian retail chains at low prices, and these products are effectively being "dumped into the market by Bangladeshi exporters".

title: Trinamool to opt out of all-party delegation to convey India’s united message
content: “Centre or Union government cannot decide unilaterally who will go from which party.. Centre should show good intent and call for a wider deliberations from all parties in the Opposition,”  Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee said

title: Kerala Plus Two Class 12 results to be declared on May 22
content: A total of 4.44 lakh students registered for the examination. Valuation of Plus Two higher secondary answer scripts has been completed

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear plea seeking FIR against Justice Yashwant Varma
content: Chief Justice B.R. Gavai agreed to list the plea for hearing after Mathews Nedumpara, who is the petitioner-in-person, sought an urgent hearing in a day or two

title: Erode elderly couple murder: Three men arrested, confess involvement in 2024 Tiruppur triple murder too
content: The arrested men have also “admitted” to their involvement in a triple murder case that took place in Semalaigoundanpalayam, Tiruppur district, on November 28, 2024

title: Supreme Court to hear case against Ashoka University professor’s arrest over social media posts on Operation Sindoor
content: Mr. Khan was remanded to two days’ police custody in one of the two cases. In the second case, filed by Mr. Jathedi, he was remanded to judicial custody

title: Uttar Pradesh ATS arrests Shahzad for suspected ISI-linked espionage acts
content: Special Task Force arrests Shahzad for alleged cross-border smuggling and espionage activities for ISI

title: Bengaluru rains: City wakes up to flooding yet again after over 100 mm of overnight downpour
content: IMD has issued yellow alert in Bengaluru till May 23, orange alert in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi, Uttara Kannada, Haveri, Belagavi

title: Massive fire hits shopping complex in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: The situation was brought under control after a five-hour long effort by 15 fire tenders from various fire stations

title: Water rising in Mandi's Pandoh dam in Himachal; flash floods block Sansari-Thirot road in Lahaul-Spiti
content: The local Met office has issued an orange warning for light to moderate rains accompanied by lightning, hail and gusty winds with a speed of 40-50 kilometres per hour at isolated places

title: What is a Presidential reference? | Explained
content: What does Article 143 of the Constitution state? Do other nations also have provisions wherein the government can raise legal questions with their respective judiciaries? What has President Droupadi Murmu raised with the Supreme Court? Should the top court answer these questions compulsorily?

title: Thunderstorm alert in 17 Telangana districts on May 19
content: The affected districts include Mancherial, Jagtial, Rajanna Sircilla, Karimnagar, Peddapalli, Rangareddy, Hyderabad, Medchal Malkajgiri, Vikarabad, Sangareddy

title: Liquor prices hike likely from today in Telangana, to be round 10% to 15%
content: The increase in prices is expected to bring in additional revenue to the tune of ₹150 crore per month

title: City hospital signs MoU with Teleflex to create a UroLift Center of Education for South Asia
content: The UroLiftTM System uses a minimally invasive approach to treating Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)

title: Vigilance set to expand probe into ‘trap case’ involving ED official
content: The agency is poised to summon for questioning the ED official allegedly involved in the ‘bribe-for-legal reprieve’ plan. Official sources say the criminal operation seems entrenched and not a one-off offence.

title: Modi govt. continues to ignore V-P's pleas on behalf of farmers: Ramesh's dig on Dhankhar's birthday
content: Earlier this month, the Congress leader had cited Vice-President’s remark that inflation should be considered while providing aid to farmers to take a swipe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking why he had not done so.

title: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra was in touch with Pak handlers during blackouts
content: Security agencies arrested YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and three others for allegedly spying for Pakistan, maintaining contact with handlers even during recent blackouts in north India. Malhotra, along with Nauman Elahi, Devender Singh Dhillon, and Arman, are accused of sharing sensitive information about vital installations. Authorities are investigating Malhotra's role in shaping narratives and Arman's connection to Pakistani intelligence operatives.

title: 'Dhamaka humne kiya': How Indian Army dealt with Pakistani shelling
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian Army responded strongly to Pakistani shelling in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in significant damage to terror infrastructure and no Indian casualties. Indian army officials confirmed that the operation was a calculated strike aimed at destroying enemy terror sites and posts aiding infiltration.

title: After 'joker' remark, Kohli-Rahul row takes surprising turn as ...
content: The public feud between Rahul Vaidya and Virat Kohli seems to be resolving as Kohli unblocked Vaidya on Instagram. This follows Vaidya's initial criticism of Kohli's social media activity and subsequent blocking. Vaidya has now expressed gratitude and praised Kohli, signaling a potential end to their digital conflict after heated exchanges and online backlash from fans.

title: 'India not a dharmshala ': SC rejects Sri Lankan Tamil’s plea seeking refuge
content: The Supreme Court rejected a Sri Lankan national's plea to settle in India after serving a seven-year sentence under UAPA for LTTE links, stating India, burdened with a large population, cannot be a 'dharamshala' for foreign nationals.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Does Biden's cancer admission prove MAGA was right about his health?
content: The arc of his life—marked by personal tragedy, quiet perseverance, and a five-decade career in public service—was the kind of political story that lent itself to grace in the end. A young senator elected at 29, a grieving father who took the oath beside his sons’ hospital beds, a seasoned legislator who steered landmark legislation across the aisle, a vice-president who stood loyally beside Barack Obama. And finally, a president elected to steady the ship after a rupture that nearly tore America apart.

title: KL Rahul set to be considered for Bangladesh T20Is
content: KL Rahul is eyeing a T20I comeback for India with Bangladesh tour the next opportunity. His recent IPL form has strengthened his case with eye on the 2026 T20 World Cup. Most recently, KL Rahul's Champions Trophy and IPL performances have highlighted his versatility. On Sunday, he scored a century in the IPL and became the fastest Indian to 8,000 T20 runs.

title: 'Opposing Modi shouldn't lead to ...': Rahul’s jet query draws Shivraj’s ire
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's questions about Indian jets shot down by Pakistan after Operation Sindoor, Shivraj Singh Chauhan urged prioritizing the nation over party politics. BJP spokesperson CR Kesavan accused Gandhi of echoing Pakistani propaganda and distrusting the armed forces. Gandhi questioned Jaishankar's remarks on informing Pakistan before strikes, prompting MEA clarification about the timing of the warning.

title: Ex-BJP MP Uday Singh named 1st national prez of Prashant Kishor's party
content: Jan Suraaj Party, founded by Prashant Kishor, appointed former BJP MP Uday Singh as its first national president on Monday. This decision comes as the party gears up for its first electoral contest in the upcoming Bihar polls later this year. Kishor had previously stated he would not hold any official position within the party.

title: 'Nation in shame': SC raps MP minister for remarks on Col Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his derogatory remarks against an Army officer, deeming his apology insufficient and a national embarrassment.

title: Baba Vanga's predictions '25: Truth behind global catastrophe predictions
content: Baba Vanga's 2025 predictions, including economic collapse, war, and natural disasters, are being re-examined amidst current global instability. Her forecasts of economic turmoil, mind-to-mind communication, and devastating earthquakes are gaining renewed attention. Past predictions like 9/11 add weight to her ominous warnings about future conflicts and extraterrestrial contact, leaving the world in suspense.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who…"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: While Travis Kelce attends Vegas event, Taylor Swift’s team shares this message
content: Taylor Nation commemorated the anniversary of Taylor Swift's 2022 NYU commencement speech, sharing inspiring quotes and reminding fans of her constant support. The post evoked emotional responses, with fans expressing gratitude for Swift's presence in their lives. Despite Swift's break, Taylor Nation ensures the connection with fans remains strong through a nostalgic post.

title: $1k for newborns and tax cuts: What is in Trump's 'one big beautiful bill'
content: Donald Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" narrowly advanced through the Budget Committee, aiming for a full House vote before Memorial Day. The bill encompasses tax relief, immigration enforcement, entitlement reform, and defense spending. It proposes tax cuts, border wall construction, Medicaid work requirements, 'MAGA' accounts for newborns, and defense spending increases, while overhauling student loan programs.

title: Yusuf Pathan opts out of all-party delegation; TMC calls it 'unilateral decision'
content: TMC MP Yusuf Pathan withdrew from the all-party delegation after the Centre's "unilateral" selection, sparking criticism from TMC leaders Mamata Banerjee and Abhishek Banerjee, who emphasized the party's right to choose its representative. Congress also questioned the Centre's selection process, deeming it "dishonest" after its suggested names were rejected.

title: Cong takes 'sindoor ka sauda' swipe at PM, brings up Trump’s mediation claim
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticised the government for allegedly informing Pakistan before strikes on terror infrastructures, questioning the potential security risks. He also attacked PM Modi over Donald Trump's claim of brokering a ceasefire, alleging a secret deal. Rahul Gandhi has also questioned Jaishankar on the same issue, while MEA has refuted the Congress's claims, calling them a misrepresentation of facts.

title: Vi shares sink nearly 9% after Supreme Court rejects AGR relief plea
content: Vodafone Idea's shares plummeted after the Supreme Court dismissed telecom companies' petitions for adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues relief, wiping out a significant portion of Vi's market capitalization. The court rejected appeals from Vodafone Idea, Bharti Airtel, and Tata Teleservices, deeming them "misconceived," reinforcing the government's stance on recovering dues.

title: YT channel slammed for distorted India map, calls it 'non-issue'
content: Real Engineering's video about Isro faced criticism in India. The issue arose from an inaccurate map depicting India's borders. Indian viewers expressed outrage over the disrespect to the nation's territorial integrity. The channel's response and subsequent comments further fuelled the controversy. The incident highlights the importance of geopolitical sensitivity when discussing other countries.

title: 'Good for jobs and bills': UK and EU agree on landmark security and defence pact
content: Britain and the European Union have forged a new security and defence partnership, enabling closer collaboration amidst escalating global threats. The agreement allows the UK defence industry to participate in the EU’s €150 billion Security Action for Europe (SAFE) fund, potentially supporting thousands of British jobs.

title: Akshay Kumar & Vicky Kaushal ‘fight’ over ‘Op Sindoor’ film? Twinkle Khanna says...
content: Twinkle Khanna confronted Akshay Kumar about a supposed fight with Vicky Kaushal over a film called 'Operation Sindoor'. The rumour, which spread online, led to a brief argument. Akshay dismissed it as fake news. He was dealing with a minor injury from a fire scene on set. Both Akshay and Vicky are currently busy with their own film projects.

title: 'ISI activated them after Pahalgam attack': Police's big charge on Pak spies
content: Punjab Police arrested two Pakistani spies. They were in contact with Pakistan's ISI. The spies became active after the Pahalgam terror attack. Authorities transferred one lakh rupees to their accounts. Both individuals are from Gurdaspur and are around 19-20 years old. They are also involved in drug activities. They leaked secret information of security forces to Pakistan.

title: 'His mistake is his name': Cong slams 'BJP manufactured rage' on prof's arrest
content: The Congress party has accused the Modi government of double standards following the arrest of Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad for a social media post critical of violence. Congress leaders highlight the stringent charges against Mahmudabad, contrasting it with the lack of action against BJP ministers accused of demeaning the armed forces.

title: Bengaluru rain: BJP MLA uses JCB to navigate flooded streets
content: Bengaluru is grappling with severe flooding due to incessant rains, causing widespread disruption and drawing sharp political reactions. A BJP MLA's symbolic JCB ride highlights the crisis as the Deputy CM pledges action amidst criticism over preparedness. Residents express frustration as rescue operations continue and the IMD issues a yellow alert for continued rainfall.

title: BCCI secretary denies India has decided to pull out of ACC events
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia refuted reports claiming India's withdrawal from Asian Cricket Council tournaments to isolate Pakistan. Saikia clarified that the BCCI hasn't discussed or decided on participation in the Asia Cup or Women's Emerging Teams Asia Cup. He emphasized the board's current focus on the ongoing IPL and the upcoming England series.

title: Rahul questions Jaishankar's silence, asks how many aircraft did India lose?
content: Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of external affairs minister S Jaishankar regarding Operation Sindoor, questioning the loss of Indian aircraft due to alleged prior warnings to Pakistan.

title: Pune Porsche crash: Adult or juvenile? One year on, no decision yet on teen driver
content: A year has passed since a 17-year-old's Porsche crash in Pune claimed the lives of two tech professionals, Ashwini Koshta and Anish Awadhia. The Juvenile Justice Board is yet to decide whether to try him as an adult, facing delays due to adjournments and quorum issues.

title: Woman’s body found in suitcase at UP home, husband held
content: In Shahjahanpur, a 31-year-old woman's body was discovered inside a suitcase at her residence, prompting a police investigation. Her husband, Ashok Kumar, has been detained for questioning. Ashok claims he found his wife hanging and, in a panic, placed her in the suitcase.

title: Sambhal mosque survey to continue as Allahabad HC rejects Muslim side's plea
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a petition seeking to halt proceedings in a land dispute between Jama Masjid and Harihar Mandir in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh. This ruling allows for the continuation of a court-ordered survey of the mosque premises, following claims that it stands on the site of a former Hindu temple.

title: Bengaluru faces pre-monsoon havoc: Roads flooded, traffic gridlock; 1 dead
content: Bengaluru is facing chaos due to heavy pre-monsoon rains. Waterlogged roads and traffic jams are paralyzing the city. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike is working to clear the roads. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru. Many areas are experiencing severe waterlogging. Traffic police are issuing warnings about slow-moving traffic. The situation remains dire for residents.

title: Op Sindoor: Did TMC opt out of Centre's all-party delegation? What Mamata said
content: Trinamool Congress (TMC) affirms its support to the Centre in combating terrorism, clarifying that while it backs national interest initiatives, the party will decide its delegation members. TMC denies boycotting 'Operation Sindoor,' emphasizing its non-politicization of the issue.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Start date, country, and format – All you need to know
content: Cricket fans eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025, scheduled for September in T20 format. Five full Asian Cricket Council members, including defending champion India, automatically qualified. They'll be joined by Hong Kong, Oman, and the UAE. India, fresh off their Asia Cup victory against Sri Lanka, also secured the Champions Trophy, defeating Pakistan and New Zealand.

title: 'Too tired': Bengal climber was abandoned in Everest ‘death zone’
content: Sherpa Palchen Tamang, accompanying Subrata Ghosh, recounted the harrowing Everest summit. Ghosh, weakened and disoriented near Hillary Step, refused to move despite Tamang's efforts. Exhausted and with dwindling oxygen, Tamang spent hours trying to move Ghosh, but was ultimately forced to descend alone, suffering hallucinations and frostbite during his own difficult return to camp.

title: ‘Spiked’ drink lands UP groom in lock-up as bride calls off union
content: In Sambhal, Kumari Shashi called off her wedding with Amit Rana. She accused him of being drunk. Amit claimed his friends spiked his drink. The bride's family alleged the entire wedding party was intoxicated. Police detained Amit and a relative. Mediation failed, and the marriage was canceled. Gifts were returned, and no formal complaint was filed with the police.

title: Uttarakhand PWD officer orders staff to offer rice at temple over missing service book
content: In Lohaghat, Champawat, a PWD officer faced repercussions after invoking a village ritual in an official order. Following the disappearance of Assistant Engineer Jai Prakash's service book, Executive Engineer Ashutosh Kumar instructed staff to offer rice at a temple, seeking divine justice. This action led to his immediate transfer to Pauri.

title: SC rejects pleas by telecom majors for AGR dues waiver, calls appeals 'misconceived'
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed petitions from Vodafone, Airtel, and Tata Teleservices seeking waivers on adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues. Justices Pardiwala and Mahadevan deemed the pleas "misconceived".

title: Sunil Gavaskar takes a jibe at Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir
content: Sunil Gavaskar criticized Gautam Gambhir for overshadowing Shreyas Iyer's captaincy during KKR's IPL 2024 victory, asserting that Iyer didn't receive due recognition. Gavaskar highlighted Iyer's significant role on the field, contrasting it with Gambhir's dugout presence. Currently captaining PBKS, Iyer is finally getting the credit he deserves, especially with Ricky Ponting as head coach.

title: Karnataka liquor shops to shut on May 21 over licence fee hike
content: Karnataka's liquor industry faces disruption. Distilleries and liquor shops plan a strike on May 20, followed by a shutdown on May 21. This action protests increased excise duties and license fees. Store owners will halt liquor purchases from government depots. Associations cite unbearable fee hikes, impacting businesses and consumers. The government aims to address revenue shortfalls with these increases.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'China gave Pakistan air defence, satellite support'
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations prompted China to provide Pakistan with crucial military and satellite support. This assistance, revealed by an Indian defence research group, included reorganizing Pakistan's radar and air defense systems and adjusting satellite coverage over India.

title: Watch: Army shows how India’s air defence foiled Pak bid to strike Golden Temple
content: Following heightened tensions and Operation Sindoor, Pakistan launched missile and drone attacks targeting Indian cities. The Indian Army, anticipating the threat, successfully intercepted these attacks, particularly safeguarding the Golden Temple from potential destruction. Modern air defence systems, including the indigenous AKASH missile system, played a crucial role in thwarting Pakistan's nefarious designs.

title: Bengaluru flooded again, residents blame official apathy, dread monsoon arrival
content: Residents of Sai Layout in Bengaluru's Horamavu are grappling with severe waterlogging and flooding, even before the monsoon season. Pre-monsoon rains submerged the area, leaving homes flooded and residents without access to clean water. The BBMP is working on temporary solutions like pumping water while a long-term project to restore the stormwater drain's width is underway with railway authorities.

title: Supreme Court orders 'one rank one pension' principle for all HC judges
content: The Supreme Court mandated the One Rank One Pension (OROP) principle for all retired high court judges, eliminating pension disparities based on recruitment source. All retired judges are entitled to a minimum annual pension of Rs 13.65 lakh, with Rs 15 lakh for retired Chief Justices.

title: Watch: Farmer's video of scooping peanuts in heavy rain goes viral
content: A distressing video surfaced showing a farmer in Maharashtra desperately trying to salvage his peanut crop from unseasonal rains. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, after seeing the video, assured the farmer of compensation and spoke with state officials to expedite aid. Many farmers were left exposed at the mandi, resulting in significant harvest damage.

title: Indian diplomats in Portugal respond to Pak protesters with posters
content: Indian diplomats in Portugal responded to a protest by Pakistani nationals near the Indian Chancery with a silent yet firm message: "Operation Sindoor is not yet over." The Indian Embassy displayed banners with this message, asserting that India will not be intimidated by such provocations. India's Ambassador Puneet Roy Kundal affirmed the embassy's steadfast approach, while also thanking the Portuguese government and police for ensuring the embassy's safety.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'My parents were in PoK,' says star England cricketer
content: England all-rounder Moeen Ali revealed his parents were near the area of India's Operation Sindoor in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK). He recounted the experience of the IPL being halted amidst escalating tensions, creating uncertainty and concern among players about potential war and travel disruptions. Moeen highlighted the difficulty of discerning truth from news outlets during the crisis.

title: Revenge attack: Delhi teen killed after dispute over booking DJ
content: In Delhi, a disagreement regarding DJ services turned deadly. Bheem Sen, an 18-year-old, was fatally stabbed in Mahendra Park. The incident occurred after an argument with a juvenile about a DJ booking. Police arrested four individuals, all believed to be juveniles. They are being processed as Children in Conflict with Law. The investigation is ongoing to recover the weapon.

title: 'Having a Pakistani background...': Ex-England cricketer recalls Ind-Pak conflict
content: Moeen Ali, playing for KKR in the IPL, recounted the unsettling experience of being in India when tensions escalated between India and Pakistan, leading to the IPL's suspension. He lauded KKR's support during the crisis, emphasizing the shared cultural similarities across the border.

title: Emergency Control Rooms, Rescue Camps: Tamil Nadu Prepares For Southwest Monsoon
content: As the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) in Chennai predicted an increase in rainfall across the state, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has instructed to ensure the Emergency control room functions 24x7 and readiness of rescue vehicles.

title: China's BeiDou, A GPS Rival, Powers Over 1 Trillion Daily Location Checks
content: China's BeiDou satellite system is now powering billions of location checks daily and backing a growing chunk of the country's tech-driven economy, new data shows.

title: 'Misbehaviour' By Rocket Motor Failed ISRO's EOS-9 Satellite Launch. What Next
content: The 'misbehaviour' of the rocket motor may have contributed to the failure of the Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) workhorse rocket on its 63rd flight, experts suggest.

title: Britain Agrees To Trade, Defence Reset With EU
content: Britain agreed the most significant reset of defence and trade ties with the European Union since Brexit on Monday after US President Donald Trump's upending of the global order forced the two sides to move on from their acrimonious divorce.

title: How Hyderabad Building Turned Into Gas Chamber As Fire Raged
content: The death of 17 members of a family, including eight children, in a massive fire has left people shocked in Hyderabad.

title: "Silence Is Damning": Rahul Gandhi Targets S Jaishankar Again, BJP Replies
content: Doubling down on his attack on External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar, senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi today reiterated his earlier claim that the Centre informed Pakistan "at the start" of Operation Sindoor

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump's Durbar: Back To 'Pax Americana' In The Gulf?
content: For its sheer optics, Trump's Gulf tour was quite over the top, with his three hydrocarbon-rich hosts going overboard in offering him mega-deals.

title: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra To Resume Through Nathu La Pass In Sikkim
content: The Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, a religious pilgrimage undertaken by the Hindus to Mount Kailash and Mansarovar Lake in the Tibetan autonomous region of China, will resume through the Nathu La Pass in Sikkim.

title: Russia Bans Amnesty International As "Undesirable Organisation"
content: Russia's prosecutor general said on Monday it had banned human rights group Amnesty International as an "undesirable organisation".

title: Foreign Secretary Briefs Parliamentary Panel On India-Pak Tensions
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri appeared before the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs on Monday to provide a comprehensive briefing on the Operation Sindoor and recent tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Pop Singer Testifies To Abuse In Sean 'Diddy' Combs Sex Trafficking Trial
content: Pop singer Dawn Richard was set to return to the witness stand in Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial on Monday, after telling a jury last week that she saw the hip-hop mogul physically and emotionally abuse his then-girlfriend for years.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Overdosed On Painkillers In 2021, Reveals Lawyer
content: Disgraced rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs had a serious overdose of painkillers in February 2012, his lawyer revealed during his sex trafficking trial in New York.

title: French State Covered Up Nestle Mineral Water Scandal: Senate Report
content: The French government "at the highest level" covered up a scandal over the treatment of mineral water by food giant Nestle, including the iconic Perrier brand, a Senate investigation said Monday.

title: All About Eli Cohen, Popular Mossad Spy Publicly Hanged By Syria 60 Years Ago
content: In 2019, Netflix released The Spy, a limited series dramatising Eli Cohen's years-long undercover operation in Syria

title: 35-Year-Old Bengaluru Woman Dies After Wall Collapses On Her Due To Rain: Cops
content: A 35-year-old woman was killed when a rain-soaked wall fell on her in the city on Monday, police said.

title: US Rejects 15 Shipments Of Mangoes From India, Cites Documentation Errors
content: The authorities in the United States tossed out at least 15 shipments of mangoes from India, citing errors in the documentation process. They instructed the exporters to either send the shipment back to India or destroy it.

title: Pope Leo XIV Meets US Vice President JD Vance Ahead Of Ukraine Ceasefire Push
content: Pope Leo XIV received US Vice President JD Vance and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio at the Vatican Monday, ahead of a US-led push to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: 220 Biggest Buyers Of $TRUMP, Crypto Memecoin Invited For Exclusive Dinner
content: More than two hundred guests, biggest buyers of $TRUMP, on Thursday will make their way to a ritzy country club just up the Potomac River from Washington, ready for a sumptuous dinner hosted by the president of the United States.

title: "Struggling With 140 Crore. India Not Dharamshala": Top Court To Lanka Man
content: India is not a dharamshala (free shelter) that can entertain refugees from all over the world, the Supreme Court said today, refusing a Sri Lankan national's plea for refuge

title: Baby Camel Falls In Tank Searching For Water, Dies. Helpless Mother Watches
content: villagers saw a baby camel stuck in a water tank while its mother stood at a distance . the camel bent its head into the open tank, in an attempt to quench its thirst . as a result, he might not have been able to maintain balance .

title: Ranking all 136 FBS QB situations into tiers ahead of the 2025 season
content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .

title: 👀 Trae Young trolls Knicks fans, praises OKC
content: the Hawks beat the new york Knicks in the Eastern Conference's first round . the defenseman's chants were broken out during a win over the knicks . he played for the Oklahoma Sooners and was inactive in the game .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: OKC routs Denver in Game 7 to advance to the WCF
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the no. 2 seed Boston Celtics beat the new york Knicks in Game 5 on friday night .

title: Premier League's longest-ever VAR check: Why is it taking so long?
content: VAR review: Why did it take the VAR over six minutes simply to confirm a goal for Nottingham Forest at West Ham United . a question of offside against Nicolás Domnguez was checked by the Darren England .

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
content: the Western Conference finals matchup is set for 2025 . the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers are poised to square off to determine which club will represent the West in the Stanley Cup Final . we're here with key intel from ESPN Research, wagering info from ESPN BET .
